content.question: The complete photoelectron spectrum of an element is given above. Which labeled peak corresponds to the <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> electrons and why?

choices.label: Peak <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> electrons are the easiest to remove from the atom.

Peak <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> electrons have the strongest attractions to the nucleus.

Peak <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because electrons in the <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel are the farthest from the nucleus.

Peak <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because there are fewer electrons in an <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel than in a <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel.

content.answer: Peak <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> electrons have the strongest attractions to the nucleus.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
